=== Current Issues ===
* The wireless nic works with this driver: http://forum.ubuntuusers.de/topic/samsung-n510-und-ubuntu/3/
   See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/708712
* Suspend can disable the keyboard input. This can be fixed by following the tutorial in posting #23 by opex in this thread: http://ohioloco.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1269262&page=3
* Suspend can disable the wireless nic. See this bug report: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-ports-meta/+bug/552717

==== Notes ====

==== fdi file for double finger scrolling ====

Add the following lines to the file '''/etc/hal/fdi/policy/11-x11-synaptics.fdi''' (which you may have to create).
<pre>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<deviceinfo version="0.2">
<device>
   <match key="info.capabilities" contains="input.touchpad">
       <merge key="input.x11_driver" type="string">synaptics</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.SHMConfig" type="string">On</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.EmulateTwoFingerMinW" type="string">8</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.EmulateTwoFingerMinZ" type="string">40</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.VertTwoFingerScroll" type="string">1</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.HorizTwoFingerScroll" type="string">1</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.TapButton1" type="string">1</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.TapButton2" type="string">3</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.TapButton3" type="string">2</merge>
       <merge key="input.x11_options.PalmDetect" type="string">1</merge>
   </match>
</device>
</deviceinfo>
</pre>

Then restart hal and gdm so the changes get accepted and you can work with 2 finger scrolling on your netbook.
